Taylor, Abdulla Amirzada, Amir Mohammad Selab, Abdul-Salam Mutteh, Ghulam Naqshband Haidari and Moeengul Gullabudeen Wardak</origin><pubdate>2006</pubdate><title>Petroleum Resource Potential GIS of Northern Afghanistan</title><geoform>Online Reports and Chapters</geoform><serinfo><sername>U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report</sername><issue>OFR-2006-1179</issue></serinfo><pubinfo><pubplace>Denver, Colorado</pubplace><publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish></pubinfo><onlink>http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2006/1179/</onlink></citeinfo></lworkcit><ftname Sync="TRUE">evapisoafg</ftname><pubinfo><pubplace>Denver, CO. U.S.A.</pubplace><publish>U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team</publish></pubinfo></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>This shapefile contains polylines (isopachs) that describe the thickness of Jurassic age evaporite facies (Gaurdak formation) in the Afghan-Tajik and Amu Darya basins</abstract><purpose>The thickness of Jurassic age evaporite facies (Gaurdak formation) is critical in analyzing both subsalt and suprasalt petroleum systems in the Afghan-Tajik and Amu Darya basins as part of an assessment of hydrocarbon resources in northern Afghanistan.</purpose><langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata><supplinf>As part of the U.S. Government's effort to aid in reconstructing Afghanistan's economy and infrastructure, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) is cooperating with the Afghanistan Ministry of Mines and Industry (AMMI) to assess the undiscovered petroleum (includes crude oil, natural gas, and natural gas liquids/condensates) resources of Afghanistan.  Funding for this effort was provided by the US Trade and Development Agency (USTDA).</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20060401</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>publication date</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>None planned</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc Sync="TRUE">59.994255</westbc><eastbc Sync="TRUE">69.036317</eastbc><northbc Sync="TRUE">40.005599</northbc><southbc Sync="TRUE">36.454025</southbc></bounding><lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">59.994255</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">69.036317</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">36.454025</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">40.005599</topbc></lboundng></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>ArcIMS Metadata Server Theme Codes Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>geoscientificInformation</themekey></theme><theme><themekt>USGS Energy Program Themes Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>Thickness of evaporite facies</themekey><themekey>Evaporite isopachs</themekey><themekey>Gaurdak formation</themekey><themekey>Earth Science</themekey><themekey>Natural Resources</themekey><themekey>U.S. Geological Survey</themekey><themekey>USGS</themekey><themekey>Afghanistan Ministry of Mines and Industry</themekey><themekey>Joint Oil and Gas Resource Assessment Team</themekey><themekey>Geology</themekey><themekey>Oil</themekey><themekey>Natural Gas</themekey><themekey>Petroleum</themekey><themekey>Resource Assessment</themekey></theme><place><placekt>Energy Program Petroleum Assessment Units</placekt><placekey>Afghan-Tajik basin</placekey><placekey>Amu Darya basin</placekey></place><place><placekey>Islamic State of Afghanistan</placekey><placekey>AF</placekey><placekey>Northern Afghanistan</placekey><placekey>Turkmenistan</placekey><placekey>TX</placekey><placekey>Uzbekistan</placekey><placekey>UZ</placekey><placekey>Southern Uzbekistan</placekey><placekey>Tajikistan</placekey><placekey>TI</placekey><placekt>U.S. Department of State - Melekhin</origin><pubdate>19750000</pubdate><title>SKHEMATICHESKAYA KARTA LITOFATSIY I MOSHCHNESTEY KIMERIDZHI-TITONSKIKH OTLOZHENIY VERKHNEY YURY YUGOVOSTOCHNOY OKRAINY TURANSKOY PLITY I PRILEGAYUSHCHIKH RAYONOV AFGANO-TADZHIKSKOY VPADINY. (Schematic Map of Lithofacies and Thickness of Kimmeridgian-Tithonian Sediments of the Upper Jurassic of the Southeast Margin of the Turanian Plate and Adjacent Areas of the Afghan-Tajik Basin.)</title><geoform>map</geoform><serinfo></serinfo><pubinfo></pubinfo></citeinfo></srccite><srcscale>1000000</srcscale><typesrc>paper</typesrc><srccitea>Mekhelin</srccitea><srccontr>Lines representing isopachs of Jurassic evaporitic facies and their thickness values.</srccontr></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>Melekhin map was scanned, registered and rectified.</procdesc><procsv>ArcMap v8.3</procsv><srcused>Mekhelin</srcused><procdate>20050220</procdate></procstep><procstep><procdesc>Line segments were digitized and attributed on screen using the Melekhin map.</procdesc><procsv>Arcview v3.0</procsv><srcused>Mekhelin</srcused><procdate>20060221</procdate></procstep><procstep><procdesc>Shapefile was projected to geographic latitude and longitude decimal degree coordinates.</procdesc><procsv>ArcTools v8.3</procsv><procdate>20050223</procdate></procstep></lineage><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>A scanned image of the original source map presented challenges in registration with base map data. National Imagery and Mapping Agency (NIMA) international boundaries and cities were used as registration points. Challenges were posed by uncertainty as to the projection of the original map and by systematic distortion of the base map used in compilation of the original map by Soviet cartographers for security reasons. The registration points were projected to an Equidistant Conic projection with reasonable parameters for this area and a Pulkovo 1942 datum commonly used on Soviet era maps. The image was scanned with a resolution of 200 dots per inch (0.13 mm), equivalent to 126 meters at a scale of 1:1,000,000. It was registered with a software (ArcMap) calculated RMS of 225 meters. Sampling differences between the rectified image and the NIMA reference points yielded an observed RMS of 2580 meters. The resulting accuracy falls below U.S. national map accuracy standards (508 meters at a scale of 1:1,000,000) by a factor of 5.08.. Users are advised that these data do not meet U.S.G.S. standards.</horizpar><qhorizpa><horizpav>2580 meters</horizpav><horizpae>Root mean square (RMS) error of registration of scanned image of original map to National Imagery and Mapping Agency (NIMA) cities and international boundaries.</horizpae></qhorizpa></horizpa></posacc></dataqual><spdoinfo><direct
